greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = 6^n - n^6.
comment: 6^n in the formula can be removed (for example) with the following Maple code: "with(gfun): rec1:={u1(0)=1,u1(n+1)=6*u1(n)}: rec2:={u2(n)=n^6}: poltorec(u1(n)-u2(n),[rec1,rec2],u1(n),u2(n)],a(n));". This yields a polynomial recurrence: {a(n+1)-5*n^6+6*n^5+15*n^4+20*n^3+15*n^2-6*a(n)+6*n+1, a(0) = 1} that can further be transformed into a linear recurrence with constant coefficients. - _Georg Fischer_, Feb 23 2021
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..200
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (13,-63,161,-245,231,-133,43,-6).
xref: Cf. A024012, A024026, A058794, A024040, A024054. - _Vladimir Joseph Stephan Orlovsky_, Jan 15 2009
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
